full_threads.body: Just a friendly reminder that this ticket has been open for over 5 days. Please close it if it's resolved or follow up if necessary. Thanks so much!

Hi Joel,

Thanks for looking into this. It wasn't displaying correctly on my phone and laptop even after multiple times of clearing my browser cache, different browsers, and even restarting my phone.

I tried a couple of things and finally was able to display correctly on both desktop and mobile on my end. I'm not quite sure why but so far

For the summary section, I changed the text editor element into a header element instead. For some reason, the style does not change on the text editor element. Then I transferred the custom CSS you created to the new header element. I've been trying to hide the element on mobile but was not working on the text header, but works fine on a header element.

I also changed the global font to Open Sans. I noticed that it was conflicting and displaying a mix of Open Sans and Montserrat. I'm not sure if its related, but I also made sure my Elementor global font is consistent with the Jupiter theme font. I will also be replacing H1 font caveat to Roboto.

Thanks for your patience and assistance on this. It's not displaying the way I want it.

Karlo

Karlo Aliling​​​​

Design Lead

MS Australia

1300 010 158

karlo.aliling@msaustralia.org.au

•

http://www.msaustralia.org.au/

Suite 3.01, 18 Flour Mill Way, Summer Hill NSW 2130

Hi Karlo,

Thanks for sending the screen recordings,

We are still unable to replicate the issue, I have made some changes to the site and cleared the site cache. I changed the line clamp to 2. Please see the link for my screen recording as well for both chrome and safari.
https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1lC9h7eClnz-0NWIrkp6mVGkLkm7Wo9aI

Can you try it now on your end?

Hi Joel

Here's a dropbox link. I included 3 screen recordings.
I tried on incognito and normal. Safari and Chrome. I'm on a MacBook and iPhone.
https://www.dropbox.com/scl/fo/rhq5cyyqhlkfm9osbqt4e/AHIihxKwdxV0Dgh-lOc_5pc?rlkey=q02epmqy6aajxvd95t65bkica&st=235uov9z&dl=0

Hi Karlo,

We are looking into this, would you be able to send a quick vid of what you are seeing on your end? and can you send what browser and OS you are using (Mac or Windows)?

Hi Joel

It's still not displaying for me correctly. I tried to create a new project and it's also not displaying correctly. I also tried to duplicate the project, compare fields, etc.

I went inside the text for one of the summaries that are displaying correctly and I saw this:

<span data-contrast="auto">Over recent decades, the clinical diagnosis of MS has evolved and improved by including imaging and lumbar puncture results in the diagnostic criteria. However, because less invasive blood-based biological signs (biomarkers) for diagnosing MS are not yet available, the diagnosis process is time-consuming and prevents MS from being treated from the earliest stage. To overcome this challenge, a better understanding of the molecular basis of MS is needed. This will help identify the key points of interventions for stopping the underlying mechanisms that trigger and/or drive MS disease activities.</span><span data-ccp-props="{"> </span>

On desktop, the font display is not the same (line-height, size, etc). And on mobile its still not hiding the overflow correctly.



Thanks
Karlo

Still the same with incognito. I also cleared history/cache on Chrome and safari mobile.

It looks perfectly fine when I view it on my desktop and manually adjust the window to trigger responsive - and all elements adjust as they should.

I might try accessing it on someone else's mobile so we can rule out that it might just be on my end.

Thanks

Hi Karlo,

We are looking into this, we can't seem to replicate the issue, it seems to be working fine on my end. Can you check in incognito mode? It could be a cache version.

Hi Joel

Do you know why this is not displaying correctly on mobile? Tried on both Safari and chrome on an iPhone.


It displays correctly on desktop: https://www.msaustralia.org.au/project/using-large-language-models-to-predict-ms-disease-progression/

I updated the line clamp to 3
-webkit-line-clamp: 2;

There are also others displaying incorrectly
Measuring all the economic impacts of MS to aid resourcing
How can we stop MS progression?

The only common thing among these posts that I noticed is having numbered lists on the summary. So I tried removing the numbered list and converted it to a normal paragraph. but did not fix the display.

I also tried to just (responsive) hide this section on mobile - but it didn't seem to work and was still showing even on mobile.

Can you please have a look when you can?

Thank you
Karlo

full_threads.body: Hi @joel need your help with this ticket. Thanks!
